page.title: 02RESIDENTS OF RAMSGATE
page.content: The population of Ramsgate is about 40,000,a number which has increased slowly over many years.A survey at our school revealed that 77% of the families had moved here within the past 10 years, most of them coming from London & the south-east.Most have come here to work.The locally born population remains fairly static,but other types of people have moved into the area.The London boroughs buy houses in the town & turn them into hostels for residents who are aged or mentally handicapped.This places a great strain on local health services.The centre of the town is mainly commercial;the next band of properties are owner occupied, & the main council estates are towards the edge of town.Many local people have Welsh or North-East backgrounds because miners moved here to work at the local coalmines 60 years ago.
